---
title: "Superoxide Dismutase 1 (SOD1)"

---

# Overall function
## Prevention of neuronal degeneration
Superoxide dismutases are a group of enzymes that eliminate oxygen free radicals that, although products of normal cell metabolism, have been implicated in neurodegeneration @osullivanPhysicalRehabilitation2019.

# Types

## SOD1
### Function
a gene that encodes the copper-zinc superoxide dismutase enzyme @osullivanPhysicalRehabilitation2019

### Mutation
one of 100s of mutations in SOD1 have been linked to hereditary [ALS]({{< var ref-amyotrophic-lateral-sclerosis >}}) @osullivanPhysicalRehabilitation2019.
